questions.question: What should you do when entering the stage to show presence?
options: Pause, scan, smile, and plant your feet
questions.answer: Pause, scan, smile, and plant your feet

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT part of the 4 Ps of vocal variety?
What is the purpose of the Speaker’s Triangle?
options: To keep you centered on stage
To support message structure through movement
questions.answer: To support message structure through movement

questions.question: What type of body language helps emphasize your message?
When should you move on stage during a speech?
options: To transition thoughts or emphasize points
questions.answer: To transition thoughts or emphasize points

questions.question: Which voice technique creates suspense or lets key points land?
How can poor posture affect your message?
What is the final step after delivering your speech?
options: Smile, make eye contact, and exit calmly
questions.answer: Smile, make eye contact, and exit calmly

questions.question: What does API stand for?
What is the primary purpose of an API?
options: To enable communication between different software systems
questions.answer: To enable communication between different software systems

questions.question: Which HTTP method is commonly used to retrieve data from a server using an API?
What response status code indicates a successful API request?
Which of the following is NOT a common data format used in APIs?
What is a REST API?
options: An API that supports real-time socket connections
An API built with Java only
An architectural style that uses standard HTTP methods
questions.answer: An architectural style that uses standard HTTP methods

questions.question: What does the HTTP status code 404 mean?
What is an API key used for?
Which tool is commonly used to test APIs?
Which of these best describes a 'POST' request?
options: Submits new data to the server
Updates existing data on the server
questions.answer: Submits new data to the server

questions.question: What does the HTTP status code 429 mean in API responses?
Which protocol does REST commonly use?
What is the difference between PUT and PATCH in API requests?
options: PUT deletes a resource, PATCH updates it
PUT is used for large files, PATCH for small ones
PUT replaces the resource, PATCH modifies part of it
questions.answer: PUT replaces the resource, PATCH modifies part of it

questions.question: What is OAuth used for in APIs?
In REST, what is an 'endpoint'?
options: A specific URL where a resource can be accessed
The last value in a database table
The final function of an API
questions.answer: A specific URL where a resource can be accessed

questions.question: Which is true about GraphQL compared to REST?
options: GraphQL allows clients to specify the exact data they need
questions.answer: GraphQL allows clients to specify the exact data they need

questions.question: What is rate limiting in APIs?
options: Limiting the number of requests a user can make
questions.answer: Limiting the number of requests a user can make

questions.question: Which HTTP method is idempotent in REST APIs?
What is the purpose of CORS in web APIs?
options: To control resource sharing across different domains
questions.answer: To control resource sharing across different domains

questions.question: What does the term 'webhook' refer to?
options: A way for APIs to fetch data from a server
An automatic callback sent from the server to a URL when an event occurs
A URL used to trigger a POST request manually
questions.answer: An automatic callback sent from the server to a URL when an event occurs
